lead_paragraph: The International Olympic Committee is asking for a halt to violence worldwide during the 2002 Winter Olympics in February in Salt Lake City, the president of committee, Jacques Rogge, said today. ''A resolution supported by the United States will be presented to the General Assembly of the United Nations for a truce, an Olympic truce,'' Mr. Rogge said during a speech at the National Press Club.
abstract: International Olympic Committee president Jacques Rogge says committee asks for halt to violence worldwide during 2002 Winter Olympics in Feb in Salt Lake City, Utah, speech; says United States will back resolution to be presented at United Nations General Assembly for Olympic truce; UN official says resolution would not endorse halt to fighting in Afghanistan; says war there will not be put aside during Olympics (S)
